item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, March 3, 2025 at 8:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Hacking the Xbox 360 Hypervisor Part 2: The Bad Update Exploit (89 points | 20 comments)
2. The power of interning: making a time series database smaller (153 points | 35 comments)
3. Ask HN: Who is hiring? (March 2025) (168 points | 141 comments)
4. SQLite-on-the-Server Is Misunderstood: Better at Hyper-Scale Than Micro-Scale (79 points | 37 comments)
5. Launch HN: Cuckoo (YC W25) – Real-time AI translator for global teams (25 points | 5 comments)
6. Chrome Returns 206 when the Server Returns 403 (45 points | 11 comments)
7. An Attempt to Catch Up with JIT Compilers (71 points | 64 comments)
8. Show HN: Knowledge graph of restaurants and chefs, built using LLMs (105 points | 31 comments)
9. Ask HN: Who wants to be hired? (March 2025) (78 points | 155 comments)
10. Show HN: Sonauto API – Generative music for developers (47 points | 32 comments)
11. The Golden Age of Japanese Pencils, 1952-1967 (88 points | 18 comments)
12. One Logo, Three Companies (15 points | 3 comments)
13. Keeling Labs (YC W23) Is Hiring an ML Engineer for Climate Tech (Los Angeles) ( | hide)
14. First flat telescope lens that captures color, detecting light from stars (63 points | 12 comments)
15. Go-attention: A full attention mechanism and transformer in pure Go (43 points | 20 comments)
16. DARPA Project Reveals One Person Can Control Dozens of Robots (17 points | 4 comments)
17. I'm starting to suspect my work is incompatible with a full-time academic job (33 points | 19 comments)
18. Show HN: Agents.json – OpenAPI Specification for LLMs (39 points | 20 comments)
19. Send Data with Sound (10 points | 7 comments)
20. Cautious Optimizers: Improving Training with One Line of Code (16 points | discuss)
21. Show HN: Firebender, a simple coding agent for Android Engineers (14 points | 1 comment)
22. Evals are not all you need (10 points | 4 comments)
23. AgenticMemory: Zettelkasten inspired agentic memory system (14 points | 2 comments)
24. Show HN: Open-Source Windows AI assistant that uses Word, Excel through COM (35 points | 11 comments)
25. MIT 6.S184: Introduction to Flow Matching and Diffusion Models (303 points | 17 comments)
26. Treasury Announces Suspension of Enforcement of Corporate Transparency Act (40 points | 36 comments)
27. Made a scroll bar buddy that walks down the page when you scroll (573 points | 181 comments)
28. Ex-SAP CTO walks away with €7.1M payout after scandal (74 points | 35 comments)
29. FlakeUI (90 points | 25 comments)
30. James Harrison, whose blood donations saved >2M babies, has died (52 points | 10 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, March 3, 2025 at 8:15 PM UTC
